question: 日記
sourceMnemonic: When you <kanji>write down</kanji> your <kanji>day</kanji> (and do it every day) that's your <vocabulary>diary</vocabulary>.
sourceReadingMnemonic:
This is a jukugo word, which usually means on'yomi readings from the kanji. Since <ja>日</ja> has two on'yomi readings, here's a mnemonic to help you remember which one to use:

When you write down your day in your <vocabulary>diary</vocabulary>, in fact you write only about <reading>Nicky</reading> (<ja>にっき</ja>). You love Nicky so much, your diary is full of Nicky this, Nicky that. Ah, Nicky is just the best.
